title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 May 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:16 <polx> has quit  
00:19 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
00:24 <Shaddox> has joined #xwiki

02:37 <ssavi> has quit  
02:37 <CIA-74> has quit  
02:39 <ssavi\_> has joined #xwiki  
02:39 <ssavi\_> is now known as <ssavi>  
02:41 <npm> has quit  
02:42 <CIA-42> has joined #xwiki  
02:46 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
03:50 <@sdumitriu> Hey ssavi  
03:50 <@sdumitriu> Any luck with the two Jira issues?  
03:51 <ssavi> Hi sergiu  
03:51 <ssavi> I almost fixed the mime type issue..  
03:51 <ssavi> I have a doubt in that..  
03:52 <ssavi> The mimetype to be excluded will be configured in xwiki.config right  
03:52 <@sdumitriu> Not quite  
03:52 <@sdumitriu> Well, you don't have to add support for the exclusion itself, you just have to make sure that the mimetype is indexed  
03:53 <@sdumitriu> The exclusion will be done at the query level  
03:53 <ssavi> oh.. I was thinking along the lines of adding suport for the exclusion..  
03:54 <ssavi> I was thinking at the query level, but that seems little ambiguous  
03:54 <@sdumitriu> This means that instead of the default Main.LuceneSearch document, someone edits it or copies it someplace else, and includes (hardcoded) an "-mimetype:image/\*" term in the query  
03:54 <ssavi> so thought will do it in xwiki.cfg  
03:55 <@sdumitriu> Or another example, a mandatory condition: "+mimetype:application/pdf" in a "Search PDFs" documents  
03:56 <@sdumitriu> But yes, the title of the issue was a bit misleading  
03:56 <ssavi> oh. .k.. thanks for the clarification..  
03:56 <@sdumitriu> You're welcome  
03:57 <ssavi> So, i have already included the index field for mime type..  
03:57 <ssavi> I could send a pull request?  
03:58 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
03:59 <ssavi> :)

13:05 <qwebirc97814> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <qwebirc97814> I have a problem with nginx with tomcat to xwiki 4.0 - Welcome to nginx! the page sais, but does not redirect to my xwiki  
13:06 <qwebirc97814> any tips on this?  
13:08 <qwebirc97814> nvm i solved it :)  
13:09 <qwebirc97814> local cache :)  
13:16 <qwebirc97814> has quit  
13:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <jvdrean> has quit  
14:23 <CIA-87> tmortagne master \* r6651041 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/66510410783a4ea1426043f6cebd5e0cb97a92ee / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-groovy/src/main/java/org/xwiki/groovy/internal/GroovyScriptEngineFactory.java : [cleanup] Apply codestyle - http://git.io/4I0jng  
14:24 <qwebirc27897> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <qwebirc27897> hello again, i asked yesterday about the IRC bot extension with the following error: The document [IRC.Translations] is listed as an internationalization document bundle but it does not exist.  
14:27 <qwebirc27897> Issue still remains that the page is just blank, i reinstalled the whole server today to see if it was something i did wrong or miss  
14:28 <qwebirc27897> but tomcat still reports that message  
14:29 <qwebirc27897> according to the guide im suppose to have an object editor that has fields to fill in  
14:31 <@cjd> what url are you looking at in the browser where you get a blank page?  
14:34 <qwebirc27897> xwiki/bin/view/IRC/IRCConfiguration  
14:34 <qwebirc27897> with my servername infront  
14:35 <qwebirc27897> i set up a nginx frontend  
14:36 <@cjd> how about trying xwiki/bin/edit/IRC/IRCConfiguration?editor=object  
14:36 <qwebirc27897> i tried the extension with the extension manager and with xar  
14:36 <qwebirc27897> aaah!  
14:36 <qwebirc27897> Great!  
14:36 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <qwebirc27897> thanks alot !  
14:36 <qwebirc27897> that solved it ^^  
14:37 <@cjd> ahh cool  
14:37 <@cjd> it was kind of a guess, I'm not every experienced with the IRC app and extension manager.  
14:37 <qwebirc27897> well that solved exacly what i tried to get answers to :)  
14:38 <qwebirc27897> you got any knowledge of xword?  
14:39 <@cjd> I'm not sure, do you mean the OpenOffice connector?  
14:40 <@cjd> I don't know of anything called xword although it might have been a name for something else...  
14:40 <@cjd> what is it, is it a connector inside of the wiki or a seperate .exe program which you run?  
14:44 <qwebirc27897> its a extension to word yes  
14:45 <qwebirc27897> to open pages in word to save directly to xwiki  
14:45 <qwebirc27897> but it fails on username/password (trust me i know the password and username is right)  
14:45 <qwebirc27897> it just fails.  
14:45 <@cjd> ahh yeah, I can't be much help with that, threw windows overboard a few years ago :)  
14:46 <qwebirc27897> its kinda xwiki office  
14:46 <qwebirc27897> its called  
14:46 <@cjd> maybe try the mailing list?  
14:46 <@cjd> I'm not sure how heavily it's used  
14:47 <@cjd> what confused me is that there's another OpenOffice based thing where XWiki connects to OO and uses it for converting documents  
14:47 <qwebirc27897> ah  
14:48 <qwebirc27897> http://xoffice.xwiki.org  
14:48 <qwebirc27897> this is the one  
14:48 <qwebirc27897> its on the main page so  
14:48 <qwebirc27897> i just hoped someone knew :)  
14:50 <@cjd> one thing that comes to mind is perhaps nginx is introducing something unexpected?  
14:50 <@cjd> by sitting between xoffice and xwiki core  
14:50 <qwebirc27897> hmm  
14:52 <qwebirc27897> but i tried the nginx adress wich connects to port 80 and i also tried the adress of 8080 that is the default tomcat  
14:52 <qwebirc27897> before and after nginx was installed  
14:52 <@cjd> ahh well, it was a thought  
14:52 <qwebirc27897> hehe any tips is appreciated  
15:02 <@cjd> tmortagne: xwiki-commons/xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-groovy/src/main/java/org/xwiki/groovy/internal/GroovyScriptEngineFactory.java:45:46: '}' is not preceded with whitespace.  
15:02 <@cjd> still working on it?  
15:04 <+tmortagne> cjd: no i'm not working on it, looking. It's weird since I executed Eclipse formater which generally properly follow theses constraints  
15:05 <@cjd> probably just that eclipse regards annotations as special whereas checkstyle doesn't  
15:11 <+tmortagne> cjd: well I never had issue with annotation on Eclipse from what I remember, anyway fixing  it  
15:12 <CIA-87> tmortagne master \* r97a1fd8 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/97a1fd84e7312cfb86087285284b3beb4a11f770 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-groovy/src/main/java/org/xwiki/groovy/internal/GroovyScriptEngineFactory.java : [cleanup] Apply codestyle - http://git.io/PrGO-w  
15:12 <+tmortagne> maybe something changed in Eclipse 4.2  
15:12 <+tmortagne> will check the forrmater

21:42 <Shaddox> has joined #xwiki  
22:57 <ries> has joined #xwiki  
22:57 <ries> Hello! good afternoon  
22:58 <ries> From the installation I am reading : select the XWiki WAR archive to deploy and set the context root to xwiki  
22:58 <ries> is there really no way to have wxiki run on a path?  
23:21 <@sdumitriu> Hi ries  
23:21 <ries> hey sdumitriu !  
23:21 <@sdumitriu> WDYM?  
23:21 <ries> Trying my first steps into xwiki :)  
23:21 <@sdumitriu> Run it under another webapp name, not the root one?  
23:22 <ries> sdumitriu: I was following this installation guide : http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationGlassFish  
23:22 <ries> and there it states : select the XWiki WAR archive to deploy and set the context root to xwiki (anything else will make XWiki navigation break)  
23:22 <@sdumitriu> Hm...  
23:22 <@sdumitriu> That's not true...  
23:22 <@sdumitriu> It should work very well with any name  
23:22 <ries> I think I already know what it means…. so you must runs as http://domain/xwiki  
23:22 <ries> Ok...  
23:22 <ries> may I ask you a other question ?  
23:23 <@sdumitriu> Sure  
23:23 <ries> I am getting an exception during deployment : could not create Vfs.Dir from url, no matching UrlType was found [bundle://176.0:1/]  
23:23 <ries> From what I was googling 'something' with reflections  
23:23 <ries> I am still researching this...  
23:23 <ries> But, doe sthat ring a bell?  
23:23 <@sdumitriu> Yes, usually that can be ignored if the wiki starts fine  
23:24 <ries> It does a redirect to http:/127.0.0.1/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
23:24 <ries> and then I see javax.servlet.ServletException: PWC1243: Filter execution threw an exception  
23:24 <ries> Could it have something to do with the fact that I try to run it over https?  
23:25 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
23:25 <@sdumitriu> It should work with https  
23:26 <@sdumitriu> Can you pastebin the whole stacktrace?  
23:26 <ries> yes I can  
23:27 <ries> I might have missed something...  
23:30 <ries> I didn't setup my DB… I thought the section was specially for MySQL on that page…. \_s  
23:38 <ries> sdumitriu: going to do a re-deploy to find a proper start point of the deployment  
23:38 <ries> currently the log get's filled fast with log messages  
23:56 <ries> sdumitriu: here is teh full stacktrace : http://pastebin.com/6QNFPSHv  
23:57 <ries> Currently I don't see the database beeing created… so I think I should start there  
23:57 <abusenius> has quit  
23:58 <@sdumitriu> Well, at the end of the log, I see this:  
23:58 <@sdumitriu> xwiki was successfully deployed in 20,765 milliseconds  
23:58 <@sdumitriu> So although the error is repeated several times, it seems to be ignored  
23:59 <@sdumitriu> When you open the wiki in the browser, what does it do?
